screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google Play Store page for the Duolingo app. The app description highlights its focus on language lessons, offering ads and in-app purchases. The page also includes buttons for "Uninstall" and "Open" and displays app suggestions like TIDAL Music, Airbnb, and Calm. At the bottom, additional apps such as "Home Workout" and "The Weather Channel" are recommended.
action_think: The current screen is showing the Duolingo app on the Google Play Store. However, the user has requested to uninstall the 'Lyft' app, which is not visible on this screen. The next logical step is to navigate back to the home screen or the app drawer to locate the Lyft app, as it is not visible on the current screen.
action_plan: Navigate back to the home screen or app drawer to locate the Lyft app.
Once found, locate the 'Lyft' app, long press on it, and select the 'Uninstall' option.
action_desc: Press the home button to return to the home screen.
action_result:
By clicking on the magnifying glass search icon, you have now entered the search interface where you can search for apps and games. This action is an important step towards fulfilling the user request, as it allows you to search for the "Lyft" app specifically. However, the next step would be to type in the name of the app, "Lyft," in the search bar to find it, and from there, you would be able to uninstall it. 

Currently, this action is a step forward but hasn't yet directly led to the uninstallation of the Lyft app.
prev_action_result: By clicking on the "Play Store" icon, I have opened the Google Play Store app. This is a necessary step towards uninstalling the "Lyft - Rideshare, Bikes, Scooters & Transit" app, as the Play Store is where apps are managed on the device. To proceed, I will need to search for "Lyft," locate the app, and then select the option to uninstall it, which will complete your request. So, this action is directly contributing to fulfilling the user request.
